intro: Hypolytrum pycnocephalum, commonly known as the dense-headed pincushion, is a flowering plant native to the Cape Province of South Africa. It belongs to the family Restionaceae, which includes many species adapted to fynbos vegetation. The plant is characterized by its compact, spherical inflorescence composed of numerous small, tubular flowers. It thrives in well-drained, sandy soils and requires full sun exposure. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
